results.title: Space: the frontiers and beyond
results.creator_credit: Peter Bucknall, Focus in Education and Visnews
results.brief_description: This is the spectacular story of man’s quest to conquer the last frontier. Rare archival film sequences of the landmarks of this 30 year struggle are featured, including the wartime V2 rocket development, “Sputnik”, “Earthrise”, the 1969 moon landing by Neil Armstrong, development of the shuttle and spacelab, and many other historic space moments.

results.title: An Interview with Arthur Harridge
results.brief_description: Even though Arthur Harridge believes each service being as important as the other, he was primarily an airforce man. He tells of leaving his home and loved ones aboard the Mariposa, bound for the United States and then Europe, where he experienced the horrors of war first hand. An emotional account of the horrors of war, the things that kept the soldiers going returning home and trying to forget.

results.title: Space cowboys
results.creator_credit: Clint Eastwood, Mad Chance, Malpaso Company, Village Roadshow Pictures and Clipsal Films
results.brief_description: In the 1950s, a US test pilot team, codenamed Team Daedalus, have been training to become the first Americans in space. They are passed over by NASA who decide to send a chimp instead. Over the years, Frank Corvin (Clint Eastwood), Hawk Hawkins (Tommy Lee Jones), Jerry O’Neill (Donald Sutherland) and Tank Sullivan (James Garner) have been forgotten and move onto other professions - Corvin becomes an aerospace engineer, Hawkins, a freelance pilot, Sullivan, a Baptist minister, and O’Neill, an astrophysicist who designs roller coasters in his free time. The four all live a quiet life until NASA learns that a Russian satellite will crash into earth, causing a major communication blackout, unless a failure in the satellite’s system can be repaired. When NASA discovers that the satellite’s system is identical to one Corvin designed, they ask him for help. He agrees, but only if he can do the repairs himself and that the original Team Daedalus can come along as his crew. ‘Space cowboys’ was produced and directed by Clint Eastwood. Cast also includes James Cromwell, Marcia Gay Harden, Courtney B. Vance, Loren Dean and William Devane.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Clint Eastwood, Mad Chance, Malpaso Company, Village Roadshow Pictures and Clipsal Films

results.title: Sous les Toits de Paris = Under the Roofs of Paris
results.brief_description:
A street singer falls for a pretty Romanian girl whom he protects from her lecherous lover, but he is accused of theft. ‘Sous les toits de Paris’ was one of the first French talkies and a remarkable experiment in sound, both technically and in its discourse on the possibilities of the new medium. Clair chose to use sound only when needed, preferring to tell the story through his visuals as much as through his dialogue. The result is a striking film, boasting beautiful photography and sets, as well as a moving story. The art direction by Lazare Meerson fixed an iconography of Paris - a sweet version of the darker ‘Poetic Realism’, full of street singers, irate concierges and neighbours, and pretty ‘midinettes’. This iconography is often re-used in the form of a nostalgic homage in recent efforts such as ‘Delicatessen’. Reference: Ginette Vincendeau. The Companion to French cinema. London: BFI publishing, 1996.

Credits: Producer, Frank Clifford ; director, Rene Clair ; writer, Rene Clair ; photography, Georges Perinal ; music, A. Bernard ; art direction, Lazare Meerson.
Cast: Polla Illery, Albert Prejean, Gaston Modot, Jane Pierson, Edmond T. Greville, Raymond Aimos.

results.title: Hope
results.creator_credit: Leslie Jones, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Les Jones heard those two magic words “It’s over”, he starting thinking about his future after the war. The middle of three generations of army men, he was part of the last major action in the Pacific part of World War II. As well as being uncertain about his future, Les also thought about those that wouldn’t be returning with him. It is with the thoughts of these lost soldiers in mind, that Les considers war and whether or not there is a better way to solve conflict.

results.title: Finding Will
results.creator_credit: Kym Levett, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: As the keeper of historical artifacts for his family, Kym Levett recently visited the parts of France that were battlefields during the Great War. He took his two sons and his mission is to find the remains of his great, great Uncle Will Cundy who had died fighting during the war. This is a story of the journey to bring Private William Cundy home.

results.title: Soylent green
results.creator_credit: Richard Fleischer, Russell Thacher, Walter Seltzer and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The year is 2022. New York City is teeming with a writhing mass of 40 million citizens, most of whom are unemployed. Strawberry jam costs $150.00 a jar and voluntary death is encouraged by Government Clinics. Food as we know it is very scarce and the people rely on a biscuit-like foodstuff called Soylent. Detective Thorn (Charlton Heston) is a harried cop investigating the death of a rich magnate (Joseph Cotten) in the dictatorial Soylent company. Edward G. Robinson, in his final screen role plays an aged and wise researcher who remembers what the earth was like with trees, vegetables and democracy. As the threads of the murder unravel, Heston finds himself face to face with the hideous truth about Soylent. Displaying an intensity of poetic and visual invention, this provocative film is a nightmarish vision of a world slowly choking itself to death. Based upon the novel by Harry Harrison.

results.title: Dots and dashes
results.creator_credit: Jacob Romeril, Kevin Coughlin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Catching mumps just before his 18th birthday prevented Kevin Coughlin from joining the RAAF during the second World War. But thanks to his connections, he was able to get work as a Wireless Telegraphist. In the end, Kevin ended up with skills that made him unique. Naturally left handed, he was forced to tap out morse code with his right hand. This afforded him a dexterity that meant he could do morse code with his right hand and write with his left which made him invaluable. He tells of his time in Darwin and, later, on Peron Island in the Timor Sea.

results.title: Sovereign hill
results.creator_credit: Peter Dodds, Penny Spence and Nine Network
results.brief_description: Filmed on location at Sovereign Hill, Ballarat, this Australian documentary recreates the nineteenth century to explain the historical events surrounding gold discovery in Australia. Produced with the assistance of the Management and Friends of Sovereign Hill Gold Mining Township. A study guide accompanies the video.

results.title: Souvenirs, Souvenirs = Memories, Memories
results.brief_description:
Paris, 1962. Rego Boccara is back from a tour of duty in Algeria and attempts to revive his singing career. His agent, Nadia, must help him fight the animosity of Firmani, an influent music-hall owner, who has vowed never to allow Rego back on stage. Meanwhile, Antoine, Rego’s younger brother, is marking time at the local high school, until the day he meets the new music teacher. This ‘coming of age’ drama is a faithful portraiture of France and its youth culture in the early 1960s. Awards: French Academy of Cinema (Cesar) 1985: Best Promising Young Actor for Pierre-Loup Rajot.

Credits: Producer, Ariel Zeitoun ; director, Ariel Zeitoun ; writer, Daniel Saint-Hamont, Ariel Zeitoun ; photography, Bruno de Keyzer ; music, Cyril Assous, Jean-Paul Dreau ; assistant director, Regis Wargnier.
Cast: Christophe Malavoy, Pierre-Loup Rajot, Claude Brasseur, Annie Girardot, Marlene Jobert, Philippe Noiret, Jean Benguigui.
